content.question: The figure above shows the forces exerted on a block that is sliding on a rough horizontal surface: The weight of the block is <math alttext="500 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>500</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the normal force is <math alttext="500 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>500</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the frictional force is <math alttext="100 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>100</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and there is an unknown force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> exerted to the right. The acceleration of the block is <math alttext="0.4 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>m</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. The value of <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
